metadata.title: CVE-2022-29599 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Apache Maven maven-shared-utils prior to version 3.3.3, the Commandlineclass can emit double-quoted strings without proper escaping, allowingshell injection attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29599` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmaven-shared-utils-java - 0.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: maven-shared-utils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
